questions.question_text:
In order to follow recommended guidelines, you will need to synchronize only those entities that are necessary to meet ProseWare's business objectives.
In addition to the typical entities synced automatically (contact, accounts, events, interactions, etc), which two additional entities will ProseWare need to enable for synchronization? Each answer represents a partial solution.

comments.content: I think if it is related to this "ProseWare, Inc. specifically wishes to avoid known issues with specific email clients.", need to avoid known issue, so there will be incident management froim clients?

discussion.content: I agree with Differentiator, but i don't understand why cases :/

Selected Answer: AD
Agreed, the Answer should be AD.

The key is your statement that "post during business day" 630 PM is after business hours.

Marketing: A website will be created. All LinkedIn messages will be scheduled to post during the business day.
All postings are to be made Public, the widest visibility.
General working hours for ProseWare, Inc. is 9am to 6pm, Monday through Friday, local time for each office.
All LinkedIn messages will be scheduled to post during the business day. -> that's why it's A. Schedule Time is set to tomorrow at 9 am.

Selected Answer: CD
I would say C,D.
C = "Smart scheduler functionality"
D = "All postings are to be made Public, the widest visibility."

questions.question_text:
The time is currently 6:30pm on Monday night. You have been tasked with creating and sending a LinkedIn post on the company's account advertising an event.
Following ProseWare's standards, which two options will you choose when preparing this message? Each answer represents a partial solution.

choices.B: Post Visibility is set to Connections.
choices.C: Schedule Time is set to immediate.
choices.D: Post Visibility is set to Public.
choices.A: Schedule Time is set to tomorrow at 9 am.

discussion.content:
From address usually defaulted so already set, but if you try set 'Ready to send' it will error saying 'Subject: The content part is missing.' 

Press in the header of the Email where it shows From / Subject and it will show you 2 mandatory fields. 

From Email
Subject

questions.question_text:
You are creating an email for an upcoming campaign. You collect all the information necessary for the email from the email marketing team.

You need to ensure the email marketing team have the minimum required information to set up the email.

Which two fields are required to set up an email? Each correct answer presents part of the solution.

NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: BD
this is correct, as "Each Business Unit has a subscription that includes a quota of 25,000 contacts; 2,500,000 Marketing email messages. Monthly reporting ensures each business unit stays within this limit."

comments.content:
I think it should be A and C. Both the numbers you mention are under the limit stated in the case. 
However, there is a limit of 1000 litmus per year. If the company does 100 per month, it would exceed the yearly limit at this rate : A
Then, There are 10 licenses for each BU including the Admin. Answer C involves 11 people, which is over the limit of 10 licenses. Then C

choices.C: Australia Business Unit has 10 regular Users and 1 Administrator User

questions.question_text: Based on ProseWare's licenses and subscriptions, which two items are within allowed limits? Each answer represents a complete solution.

choices.B: Add it to a content block, then add the content block to the marketing page.
choices.E: Edit the raw HTML in the Page Designer in the marketing pages.
choices.D: Change the settings in Properties in the Page Designer in the marketing pages.
choices.A: Add it to the Portal Integration tab of the marketing page.
choices.C: Add it to the marketing page template.

You need to ensure the pages all use the same style sheet.

What are two ways to add the style sheet? Each correct answer presents a complete solution.

NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.
